title: The Creature in the Machine
content: In this week’s episode, Nate reflects on his experience with knee surgery and being a “creature in the machine” (the Superorganism).
creator: Nate Hagens
sourceDescription: Insight and inspiration in turbulent times.

title: The winners take the most
content: From 2018 to 2020, the top four seed and agro-chemical firms controlled 60-70% of the global pesticides market, and 50-60% of the $45 billion global seed market. How did this happen?
creator: Gunnar Rundgren
sourceDescription: Insight and inspiration in turbulent times.

title: How Can Scientists Resist the Climate Status Quo? A Conversation Between Fernando Racimo and Frederik Appel Olsen
content: Knowledge is important, sure, but if we don’t do anything with that knowledge, if we don’t organize for collective action, then all claims that science is a positive agent for change are just empty talk. Science can help us transform society, but only if we dare to transform science itself.
creator: Semine Long-Callesen
sourceDescription: Insight and inspiration in turbulent times.

title: Redesigning Utopia: Why Free Money for Everyone Would Not Solve the Polycrisis
content: In the interests of both local and global sustainability, we need to redesign the economy by recognising two separate spheres of exchange, representing two different kinds of values.
creator: Alf Hornborg
sourceDescription: Insight and inspiration in turbulent times.

title: The slow forces behind this year’s fast crises
content: Systemic risk analysis allows us to fully comprehend the long-tail of all the crises peaking this year. But it also reveals how we can turn these exponential curves around, accelerating just as fast and as far in the opposite direction.
creator: Ajay Gambhir
sourceDescription: Insight and inspiration in turbulent times.

title: The Empire Crumbles: Part I—The Big Picture
content: Don’t cower in front of your screen. Get out and join with others in projects to make your town stronger and more socially and environmentally sustainable.
creator: Richard Heinberg
sourceDescription: Insight and inspiration in turbulent times.

title: By the Rivers of Babylon: debating agrarianism with Tom Murphy
content: There’s nothing much we can do about this world-as-it-might-be symbolic capacity we have, simultaneously humanity’s blessing or genius and also our curse. Writing, farming and so on were not the cause of our malaise but the result of it.
creator: Chris Smaje
sourceDescription: Insight and inspiration in turbulent times.

title: Ditching Dualism #10: Determinism
content: One major hangup in subscribing to a physics-based universe of material monism is that it appears to remove human agency as typically conceived in our culture. If atoms and their interactions are making everything happen, abiding by rules they (or we) cannot violate, is there any room left for human intervention or free will?
creator: Tom Murphy
sourceDescription: Insight and inspiration in turbulent times.

title: Crazy Town: Episode 118. Choose your AI Adventure: Immiseration or Extinction
content: Jason and Asher replace Rob with a much more humane and humble co-host, Elon Musk, to explore the feasibility of harnessing the entire sun to power AI superintelligence. We come away perplexed that not much of the excellent reporting on the environmental, energy, and financial risks of the AI boom address the googleplex-sized elephant in the room – that both AI success and failure lead to immiseration.
creator: Asher Miller
sourceDescription: Insight and inspiration in turbulent times.

title: The Being Way of Degrowth
content: For those of us seeking post-capitalist futures: rather than burning ourselves out Doing — the energy of the capitalist system we are trying to topple — why not try Being, the energy of degrowth?
creator: Jane W. Wang
sourceDescription: Insight and inspiration in turbulent times.

title: Plants and the great cognition debate
content: If Calvo is out at the front, all the same, he’s not there on his own. Colleagues in the field also believe that the ‘machine metaphor’ of body and brain is getting in the way of understanding—even preventing us from seeing what’s in the data we see in front of us.
creator: Andrew Curry
sourceDescription: Insight and inspiration in turbulent times.
